reviewText:
Do not purchase.

This is Emergency 5 rehashed but it doesn't even fix a large amount of the issues that were present. Same sub-par optimization and glitches ruin the experience. If you want you can try your $5.99 at it during the promotion period, but I would not recommend supporting this developer until they get their act together.

The pinnacle of this series was Emergency 4 (911: First Responders" in the US and on Steam) with the LA Mod. I wish Sixteen Tons Entertainment would recognize it's popularity and collaborate with Hoppah or expand on his interpretation of the game."

reviewText:
As someone who works in the emergency medical field, I really appreciate and enjoy this game. In fact, all this week after each of my long shifts on the ambulance, I've been coming home to play this; actually looking forward to it. The game isn't without faults, but I'll list each fault for you, as well as each positive point.

The Good:
+The graphics are nice and for the most part, I can get 60 fps (unless there are six emergencies going simultaneously).
+The animations are pretty sweet. For example, while checking patients, the doctor has several animations depending on the injuries...he will take out his stethescope for a sick person, start a fluid bolus on a trauma patient, and take out his pen light to asses the pupils of a patient with a head injury. Sometimes I just stop what I'm doing to watch the doctor.
+Additional content compared to the other games.
+Some pretty wicked calls to go to, including: hostage situations, bomb threats, robberies, medical emergencies, mva's, gas explosions, forest fires, building collapses, protests, missing persons...you get the point.
+Day/night cycle. The weather also changes..so far I've only seen light rain and rarely a thunderstorm.
+A.I. seem to be improved from previous games.
+Level editor, although it's not too user friendly..unless you're familiar with SDKs, which I'm not.

The Bad:
-As mentioned by others, the tracking issues are still present, but for me they haven't been too bad. The worst issue I had was with the search and rescue K9 vehicle making a loop around the block to get to an area literally 20ft away from the truck. And after I gave up on the missing persons mission, I sent it back to base, and it drove off the road and got stuck. That was frustrating, but in the end, it didn't break the game for me.
-So far I've had two unexplained crashes while playing free play (I've submitted bug reports).
-Minor glitches here and there.
-Pedestrian A.I. seem to be pretty stupid. For example, if there is a fire in a building next to a sidewalk, the pedestrians will walk right next to it and sometimes can injure themselves.
-I never purchased EM5 (the negative reviews scared me away), but from what I've seen and heard, this is basically a DLC and should not be marketed as a new stand-alone game. It's pretty much a re-skin.
-Pricey for what you get.

Conclusion:
When all is said and done, I can personally look past the glitches. I enjoy playing the game and find it to be relaxing. I also understand why some people are ♥♥♥♥♥♥ off at the marketing of this game. Hopefully this game doesn't go the route of Train Simulator 2016" where every year the devs release a "new" game with <insert year here> in the title

reviewText:
So heres my review so far:

Pros:
+ Good graphics
+ Sorta good AI
+ Nice maps
+ Moddable (no workshop)
+ Lots of varieties of vehicles
+ Campaign
+ Sandbox mode (just all the vehicles and infinite money I believe)

Cons:
- Vehicles tend to jerk a lot
- Vehicles drive on the sidewalk which makes it a bit unrealistic
- Not too much to the game but the same thing every 30 seconds
- HUGE amount of glitches
- Didn't fix a huge amount of glitches from the other emergency games they made
- Game often crashes during mid game.

Theres a lot of glitches and bugs the game dev's NEED to fix. They will hopefully patch those soon. For now, I would recommend this game but only if it's on sale.

Usually I would give it about 9/10, but all the bugs n stuff I would say 7.2/10.

reviewText:
Did I enjoy the new missions? Mostly, whenever they worked.
Can I honestly recommend it to existing player or even new players? Not really.

The game is (still) severely bugged and broken. Units will go missing or lock up. Automation will only work every now and then, most of the time a paramedic will stand next to a slowly dying patient without lifting a finger. Pathfinding is still a WorkInProgress kinda deal, far too often will units get stuck in traffic/buildings/eachother/imaginary stuff or simply wander off across the map. I also saw multiple crashes during the 4 hours it took me to complete the new missions -- not that it has 4 hours worth of content, most of the time was spent figuring out workarounds for whenever the game didn't work correctly. Restarting a mission for the 7th time because a broken game mechanic randomly failed you isn't challenging content"

reviewText: It's alright. I haven't played the rest of the series, so I don't have anything to compare it to, but I personally like it. However, it has more cons than pros. First off, vehicles and the little people you command seem to get stuck in random places quite often. I've had fire engines wedge themselves behind buildings, and firefighters get stuck between trees. Also, you can never get vehicles to line up or park the way you want them to, they always figure a way to put themselves at some stupid angle that makes the crew have to walk halfway around the city to get back in.

reviewText:
Okay, I'll start by going over the pros:

- Good story line
- Realistic vehicles
- The maps aren't big, but they aren't small either. A good size
- Reasonable graphics.

And the cons:

- Quite frankly, the pathfinding of these stretcher bearing idiots is $h!t. Sometimes takes a little hit and miss, but they eventually get to where they want to go.
- There are still plenty of glitches, such as rescue dogs finding someone, but the person not actually showing up - dogs bark at invisible things
- People standing around doing nothing. The function of a fireman is simple: put out fires, and rescue people. If a fireman is wearing his firefighting clothes, and arrives at a fire in a fire truck, what should he do? The obvious answer is put out fires, not wait around for me to tell him to pull out his hose, and start fighting a specific fire. And, once the fire's out, he doesn't move, he keeps spraying water onto the same object!
- Accidentally overwrited a save, would have liked a WARNING! This action will overwrite any existing game in progress!".

Overall
date: the game is quite fun. Good simulation games are getting harder and harder to come across
recommended: and this is certainly a step in the right direction for Sixteen Tons and Deep Silver. I'm not a fan of this whole plague theme
hoursPlayed: but that's just my opinion.\n\nMy Rating: 7/10."

reviewText:
Includes Emergency 5 (Deluxe Edition) along with the contents of Emergency 2016. In the seven hours I have spent on this game, five of them have been on the new campaign. 90% of the time you have to restart a mission in the campaign because they glitch out. I spent two hours playing freeplay and crashed about eight times. I get perfectly fine frames per second (around 50-60) and I already checked the cache multiple times, but it still crashes. Bad coding and reuse of old code from Emergency 5 makes me cry. When they initially released the game, it didn't come with any way to play it so it was a bit of a scam, but I emailed technical support and they were fairly quick to fix it.

Pros:
Fun if you can get over the crashes and bugs
Good time waster
Includes Emergency 5 and Emergency 2016

Cons:
Buggy
Glitchy
Bad coding causing crashes
In this new Plague" mode you only get two
date:
one-event missions in the medieval map they made

My overall rating: 4.5/10

WOULD NOT RECOMMEND"

reviewText:
I'm sorry to say but, I mean Developers...When will you decide to listen to the community?

EM4 is Still higher rated than all of your more recent Emergency Series. That there is a problem you should think of how to tackle. Yet it has a very simple solution.

You say that you made EM5 all made to be modded etc... Yet only 1 Major mod has been released with very few others in progress. And then for Em4 mods are still being made to this date. Now for me, the thing that made EM4 was the mods. I have played soo much of that game, enjoying a HUGE variety of mods. So after that very successful game you decided to Bring Emergency 2012 out. Which was hopeless. But then you decide to bring Emergency 2013, which again was hopeless. But then no, you decide to make Emergency 2014..... Once again rubbish. So then you make Emergency 5. Didn't work.  Not stable, barely moddable etc... So then you realise its time to bring out a copy-pasted version of Emergency 5, add a few extra missions, anotehr vehicle and there you have it! A new game... Emergency 2016. Makes me laugh really. I'm NOT saying that you Devs are bad at what you do in any way but I mean common... It doesn't take that much common sense to see what needs to be done. I'm annoyed because you are ruining a great Game series every game on.

Now here is what I propose. I doubt it will be considered as barely anything the modded community says is... but:

Since you pretty much copy-pasted Em5 and made it a new game. Ok, Copy - Paste EM4. Same Editing system, layouts... EVERYTHING. Yet, make the graphics better, add some new cool features and that is it. You will actaully have done what is really wanted. Instead ofcourse go and Release Emergency 2017 in a year with a new vehicle and mission... Why not.

reviewText:
Sadly this game lacks lots of improvment that is needed to make it as much fun as 911:First Responders/Emergency 4.
While they have improved some aspects of automation they have missed some basic fuctions that make this game stupid.
Fire:
Can not get a hose from a normal engine only the heavy rescue?
Only 1 hose per hydrent?
Can not connect to an engine?

Medical:
No paramedic on an ambulance?

Police:
No riot police?
No (Intercept) option to take down criminals?
No patrol option to keep cars in the area?

These are just some of the glaring omissions from this game that should have been put in. You can do all of this in E4 with the LA mod so why not take that and put it in the main game?

Thankfully I have not had any game bugs or crashes as others have but the total lack of inovation from the development team means you should not waste your money on this sub par game.

If I could get a refund I would, lets just hope they bring out a LA" Mod for this game soon so its playable."
